locutie.beschrijving: A theological exploration of the nature of preaching as a 'speech-event'. The preacher uses historical anecdotes (Churchill, MLK) and biblical theology (John 1, Romans 10) to define the Word of God.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Correctly identifies the 'acoustical' nature of biblical revelation and the Christological center of the Word.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting a theology of preaching. The preacher is 'talking about' the power of the Word rather than 'performing' the Word to the congregation.
voorbeelden: Christian preaching is different from any other kind of public address.
Preaching is a human activity, but it is derived from God.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To convince the hearer of the importance of preaching and to instill a sense of awe for the 'speech-event'.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly mentioned via 1 Cor 2:1-5, but the sermon itself relies more on theological explanation than on invoking the Spirit's present action.

voorbeelden: God does not exist in unbroken silence.
The agent of the creation itself is the Word of God.
This is poorly understood in the mainline churches today.
May we open our lives to the Word of life.
I am amused to remember his own arrogance.
I was duly dashed for a while.
Jesus Christ has promised to be present in power.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. The preacher reports that God has promised (Assertive about a Commissive) rather than speaking the promise directly to the hearer.

declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher avoids the 'I forgive you' or 'I declare to you' stance in favor of a 'We are all in this together' stance.

indicatoren: Extensive use of 3rd person descriptions of God.
Historical anecdotes used as illustrations of a principle rather than acts.
Theology of the 'Word' remains an object of study.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer learns a lot about the Word of God but may not experience being addressed by God.

missende_elementen: Direct promise ('God says to you today...')

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The sermon talks about the concept of 'Toezegging' but does not execute one.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes and 'we' as a collective of believers.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Mostly hypothetical or general ('You may be shocked').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Low. Not used for direct blessing or promise.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant. Talking about God, the Word, Churchill, and the Church.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: High. It treats the Gospel as a topic of discussion.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Churchill, MLK, personal history, biblical history.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological definitions of how preaching works.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon is almost entirely Assertive (explanation of the Word) ending in a vague Directive/Wish (May we open our lives).
voorbeelden: Explanation of John 1 -> 'May we open our lives'.
foutief_patroon.probleem: It lacks the middle step: the actual Declaration of grace to the hearer.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: The indicative is a lecture on theology, the imperative is a soft wish.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a 'meta-sermon'. It is a sermon about preaching, but it fails to be the very thing it describes. It provides excellent information about the 'speech-event' without becoming one.

sterke_punten.effect: Provides a solid intellectual foundation for faith.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus Christ has promised to be present in power.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Reporting a promise is not the same as making a promise.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It remains a lecture on the theology of the Word. The 'event' is described but not enacted.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher acts as a professor of homiletics rather than a mandatory of God.

openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher describes himself as a 'channel', but speaks mostly in his own voice.
tekstueel_bewijs: God has turned his message over to us.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, acknowledges that only God makes it happen.
tekstueel_bewijs: demonstration of the Spirit and of power

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Affirmed in theory, but the sermon functions as a lecture.
tekstueel_bewijs: When the Word of God is read and expounded... it has the character of an event.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is' and 'was' verbs. Needs more 'I' (as God's mouthpiece) and 'You' (as recipient).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Jesus Christ has promised to be present in power.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Jesus Christ is here now, and He promises you His power.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a report to a present-tense promise.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The grace of God is treated as a historical fact rather than a present gift.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Insert a direct address of comfort.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because Christ is the Word, I declare to you that your sins are gone.
God is speaking to YOU in this moment.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative is disconnected from the indicative.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Base the 'opening of lives' on the 'finished work' just declared.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is a brilliant essay on homiletics, but it must move from 'talking about' the Word to 'being' the Word for the congregation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (the anecdotes). SAT reveals that the preacher's self-revelation is actually a distraction from the 'Declarative' act of God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the Churchill/MLK examples are great. From SAT, they are merely 'Assertives' that don't perform a divine act.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT exposes that a sermon can be 100% orthodox and 0% performative.

appendices.notities: The preacher is trapped in the 'meta-level'. He is so fascinated by the theory of the Word that he forgets to speak the Word.
